item.title: Albury's Macquarie Textiles celebrated for decades of manufacturing
item.description: Textile manufacturing took Albury's work to the Opera House, federal parliament, the Olympics and beyond.

item.title: The first Wright Brothers invented the airplane, but these two are creating comics for kids
item.description: When boys write their own comics, they are bound to be full of fart jokes, stinky-eyed butt dragons and lots of crazy superpowers.

item.title: This punchy olive and feta salad will lift any meal - ABC News
item.description: With a mix of marinated olives, red onion, capsicum and creamy feta, tossed with fresh herbs and a zesty lemon-garlic dressing, this salad pairs perfectly with grilled meats, seafood or a mezze spread.

item.title: Amyl and the Sniffers, Tame Impala, Rüfüs Du Sol secure 2026 Grammy nominations
item.description: Amyl and the Sniffers, Tame Impala and Rüfüs Du Sol will represent Australia at the 68th Annual Grammy Awards next year. Here is the full list of nominees.

item.title: Kangaroos focus on 'wonderful opportunity' in final Ashes Test against England at Headingley
item.description: The Kangaroos may hold an unassailable 2-0 lead in the Ashes series, but they have not been completely satisfied with their performances in England.

item.title: Sudan's crisis has entered a dramatic new phase — but it started years ago
item.description: The latest chapter in Sudan's civil war has captured the world's attention. To understand what's happening now it helps to understand some of the country's history.

item.title: Plan to save sacred Millstream aquifer welcomed amid water sustainability concerns
item.description: With sacred springs and water holes in northern WA drying up, the WA government decides to relocate where it is extracting groundwater from.

item.title: Inside the debate over the glass elevator Bali is building on 'world's most beautiful beach'
item.description: A new addition to Kelingking Beach has locals and tourists in an uproar, deeply dividing many along Bali's tested fault line — development versus environmental conservation.

item.title: New Zealand's Shanice Parker to face Australia in Pacific Cup final in Sydney
item.description: Shanice Parker is the daughter of a Jillaroos World Cup player, but meeting her biological father as a teenager has prompted her to represent New Zealand.

item.title: Carlton beats West Coast by 41 points in AFLW elimination final at Princes Park
item.description: Carlton stuns West Coast with a dominant AFLW finals win, as Mia Austin honours her late cousin Ben with an emotional goal at Princes Park.

item.title: Police allowed neo-Nazi protest outside NSW parliament
item.description: A neo-Nazi rally outside the NSW parliament on Saturday morning was deemed "authorised" because police had chosen not to oppose the public assembly.

item.title: India wins T20 series against Australia after washout at the Gabba
item.description: Stormy weather ensures only 4.5 overs are bowled in the fifth and final T20 match between Australia and India in Brisbane.

item.title: Police investigating if teen suspect in Indonesia mosque explosion was radicalised
item.description: Almost 30 people, mostly school students, are being treated in hospital after at least two explosions at a North Jakarta mosque during prayers on Friday.

item.title: Israel identifies latest hostage body as Lior Rudaeff, as families await five more
item.description: Five deceased Israeli hostages are yet to be returned as part of the ceasefire agreement with Hamas.

item.title: Australia secure 3-0 Ashes whitewash with 22-point win over England in third Test
item.description: The Kangaroos have secured a 3-0 Ashes victory with Harry Grant leading the way in a big win over England at Headingley.

item.title: Wallabies fall to Italy 26-19 in Udine Test to record consecutive defeats
item.description: The Wallabies slump to consecutive defeats on their spring tour, as Italy comes from behind to win in Udine.

item.title: Australia's democratic system is unlike any other on Earth
item.description: Behind the quirks of Australia's incredible democratic system are a series of complex human backstories.

item.title: How the dismissal of Gough Whitlam's Labor government in 1975 was sealed by the Senate
item.description: Before Gough Whitlam's dismissal and famous speech on the steps of Parliament House, there was silence — and strategy — in the Senate. This is the inside story of how a budget stand-off changed Australian democracy forever.

item.title: Are political differences impacting your relationship? Share your story
item.description: Research shows political differences are increasingly impacting relationships. Share your story here.

item.title: Cape Barren Island's Marra Wunna golf course, where shoes are optional
item.description: Golf has a reputation for being expensive and exclusive — but on this island in Bass Strait, things are a bit more relaxed.

item.title: 'World's first sex worker statue' returns home after 30 years
item.description: Joy, a sculpture by artist Loui May, was erected in Sydney's Darlinghurst in the late 1990s. After hundreds signed a petition for its return, a bronze version was created and placed in the spot it once stood decades ago.

item.title: Samoan fans line the streets of Apia ahead of match against New Zealand
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Elena Rybakina defeats Aryna Sabalenka to win WTA Finals and collect record prize money
item.description: Elena Rybakina has defeated world number one Aryna Sabalenka to win the season-ending WTA Finals, 6-3, 7-6(0).

item.title: Zohran Mamdani gave these New York women 'a glimmer of hope'. They helped make him mayor
item.description: Zohran Mamdani's victory in Tuesday's New York City mayoral election looked unlikely at one point. Polling shows it was women who helped power him into office.

item.title: Die My Love filmmaker Lynne Ramsay on realising a punk rock adaptation of Ariana Harwicz's novel
item.description: After reading Die My Love in book club, Martin Scorsese knew it had to be made into a film. Now it's rewriting cinema's portrayal of womanhood and postpartum depression.

item.title: Australia Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters says rugby league Ashes needs to continue after defeating England 30-8 in third Test
item.description: Australia coach Kevin Walters has dismissed suggestions the Kangaroos' whitewash series win over England was "a walk in the park", praising his counterparts following the third Test.

item.title: UN photographer Martine Perret turns lens on women of Australia's hinterland
item.description: Parisian-born UN photographer Martine Perret turns her lens to capture the resilience and strength of women in rural Australia.

item.title: Russian strikes on apartment building, energy sites in eastern Ukraine kill four
item.description: A Russian drone slams into an apartment building in eastern Ukraine, killing three people, while another is killed at an energy site, Ukrainian authorities report.

item.title: New food safety rules for produce in Tasmania have smaller growers worried
item.description: The new regulations would bring Tasmania into line with national standards, but smaller growers are worried they will have to pay the same fees and meet the same auditing requirements as large-scale growers.

item.title: Women's pain inquiry finds Victorians' suffering worsened by male-centred healthcare system
item.description: A Victorian inquiry has found a dismissive and disrespectful healthcare system centred around men is contributing to poorer outcomes for women and girls.

item.title: Spearmint milk and Hawaiian packs included in celebration of WA's food history
item.description: An exhibition exploring Western Australia's food history in all its guises, including its fast-food pioneers, is on show at the State Library.

item.title: Wallabies lament poor performance in 26-19 Test rugby loss to Italy
item.description: Wallabies captain Harry Wilson says he is "hurting" after Australia's 26-19 loss to Italy, while coach Joe Schmidt is lamenting his side's "flat performance".

item.title: The J Awards has been loud and proud about Australian music for 20 years
item.description: The centrepiece of triple j's Ausmusic Month celebrations, the J Awards is celebrating its 20th anniversary in 2025. Here's how it all began.

item.title: Annemarie Manders reflects on 35 years as a lavender farmer in the Yarra Valley
item.description: Annemarie Manders reflects on how she became a lavender farmer in the Yarra Valley.

item.title: Feelings of failure and being unseen. What it's like to be a stepmum
item.description: There is no road map for step-parenting, and experts say a common mistake is assuming it will be easy.

item.title: AFLW finals: Brisbane Lions beat Melbourne by 13 points to reach prelim final, Adelaide beats St Kilda
item.description: Brisbane defeats Melbourne for the first time in AFLW finals, as the Lions win on the road to clinch a preliminary final spot, and Adelaide ends St Kilda's season.

item.title: Australia beats New Zealand 40-8 to defend Women's Pacific Cup crown
item.description: Julia Robinson scores twice as Australia defeats New Zealand 40-8 to claim a second consecutive Pacific Cup in emphatic fashion.

item.title: Majority of Australia's first Ashes Test squad to feature in Sheffield Shield round four
item.description: Fourteen members of Australia's 15-man squad for the first Ashes Test will take part in this week's Sheffield Shield fixtures, while England will play an intra-squad game in Perth.

item.title: Why the Pacific Championship final should be a look into rugby league's future
item.description: New Zealand stopped Samoa from making history in the Pacific Championship final but the match was a tantalising reminder of what's possible for rugby league in the days to come.

item.title: From jackaroo to 'Golden Tonsils' radio titan: the life and career of John Laws
item.description: John Laws, also known as "Golden Tonsils", spent a mammoth 71 years on air at stations such as Sydney's 2UE and 2SM, before retiring in November 2024.

item.title: Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin's remains return to Israel
item.description: Hamas hands over Hadar Goldin's remains as part of its ceasefire agreement with Israel.

item.title: Alex de Minaur defeated in ATP Finals by Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(5), 6-2
item.description: Top seed Carlos Alcaraz began his bid for a first ATP Finals trophy with a 7-6(5), 6-2 win over Australian Alex de Minaur in their round-robin clash at the season-ending championships in Turin on Sunday.

item.title: Tassal suffers fish kill at barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay amid expansion plans
item.description: Foreign-owned aquaculture company Tassal suffers a fish kill at its barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay, where the company has plans to expand.

item.title: Victoria's Wurundjeri people file native title claim for Melbourne
item.description: The Wurundjeri Woi-wurrung people in Victoria have filed a native title claim with the Federal Court, seeking recognition over country that spans much of Melbourne.

item.title: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to return 'Yellow Peril' home
item.description: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to take the city's controversial "Yellow Peril" sculpture.

item.title: AFL gives teams finishing 10th chance to win premiership through wildcard round in finals
item.description: AFL teams ranked ninth and 10th will be in contention to win the premiership from next season, with the league introducing a wildcard round.

item.title: Federal politics: Albanese picks former Labor premier for top diplomatic role in UK — as it happened
item.description: Anthony Albanese announces the next high commissioner to the United Kingdom, a former South Australian premier. Look back at our coverage today.

item.title: Respected engineer sounds alarm on extent of defective Darwin apartment buildings
item.description: A respected consulting engineer says about 80 per cent of apartment buildings he has inspected in Darwin have serious structural issues.

item.title: Exhibition depicting Geraldton homelessness shown at Canberra's Parliament House
item.description: A portrait exhibition of people who have experienced homelessness is opening up conversations to show everyone has a story worth listening to.

item.title: Why Oscar Piastri was handed a 10-second penalty during the F1 São Paulo Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri was involved in the biggest flashpoint of the Formula 1 São Paulo Grand Prix, earning him a costly penalty and damaging his chances of winning the drivers' championship.

item.title: More than 2,800 US flights cancelled in a day as government shutdown persists
item.description: More than 2,800 domestic flights are cancelled in the United States over the course of a single day due to an ongoing shortage of air traffic controllers.

item.title: French 'Fedora man' pictured at Louvre heist scene unmasked as teenager
item.description: A 15-year-old is unmasked as the "Fedora man" in a viral image taken outside the Louvre on the day of the crown jewels heist.

item.title: This street is home to two cities with opposite laws and politics
item.description: These two US cities share a name and a main street, but come election time, following the rules on one side of the road could land you in jail on the other.

item.title: Richmond set to host 'home' AFL fixture in Tasmania for the first time in club's history
item.description: Richmond will run out for a home game in Tasmania for the first time in its history next season in a decision the club says it has not taken lightly.

item.title: The AFL's Wildcard Round has been met with negative reviews, so why does it exist?
item.description: Footy fans are not impressed with the AFL's new finals-extending Wildcard Round, but it is all part of Andrew Dillon's grand plan for total domination of Australian sport.

item.title: Family and police appeal for information linked to Brandon Yates's fatal stabbing
item.description: Police launch a public appeal to help find the killer of 28-year-old man who died from stab wounds in Wollongong's main street.

item.title: Canberra man given three-year sentence for sexual offences against 11-year-old girl
item.description: Canberra man Shegu Bobb has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court for a series of sexual offences against an 11-year-old girl, after a jury found him guilty earlier this year.

item.title: Redress scheme opens for 3,000 Stolen Generations survivors in WA
item.description: Survivors of the Stolen Generations in Western Australia can now apply for $85,000 in compensation as part of a government redress scheme.

item.title: Thinking about an e-bike or e-scooter for your kid? Here's what's legal and safe
item.description: E-bikes and e-scooters might sound like an exciting gift for a teenager or child, but experts say there are several things to consider before buying one.

item.title: Who is Jay Weatherill, Australia's new high commissioner to the UK?
item.description: Australia's next high commissioner to the United Kingdom's time in politics was defined by consultative leadership, pizza politics and a gatecrashed press conference.

item.title: Measles warning issued for South West and Great Southern as confirmed case numbers climb
item.description: Authorities and experts urge people in the state's south to be on alert for measles as the number of community transmission cases continues to climb.

item.title: Nampijinpa Price pulls out of Put Australia First rally appearance with far-right activist Tommy Robinson
item.description: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was due to speak at the Put Australia First event later this month alongside Tommy Robinson, a one-time member of a fascist political party.

item.title: Mitchell Starc fires Ashes warning in Sheffield Shield return as Jake Weatherald and Beau Webster fail to fire
item.description: Mitchell Starc enjoys a successful return to red ball cricket while representing New South Wales but Jake Weatherald and Beau Webster fail to grab their opportunities.

item.title: Donald Trump pardons Rudy Giuliani and others involved in trying to overturn 2020 election
item.description: The US president has pardoned his former lawyer Rudy Giuliani and others who were involved in trying to overturn the 2020 election.

item.title: Cardiac patient reveals urgent surgery at Sydney public hospital was cancelled four times
item.description: Ian Parker waited more than three months for urgent heart surgery that should have been done within 30 days. He was inspired to share his story after an ABC investigation.

item.title: Federal politics: Greens, Coalition question why Nauruan president's visit was kept secret — as it happened
item.description: The Coalition and the Greens call on the government to explain why the high-level visit with Nauruan President David Adeang was not made public.

item.title: Micro parties on the rise as discontent with major parties grows in regional NSW
item.description: As voters demand better political representation in the bush, two new micro parties in the NSW Riverina region promise to be a solution.

item.title: Stunning icicle kick by David Rodríguez wins Canadian Premier League final
item.description: A blizzard, a sensational overhead kick goal, snowploughs clearing the pitch for extra time — the Canadian Premier League soccer final had it all.

item.title: Owners barred from Beachport holiday units after council fire safety change
item.description: Meg Longstaff hoped to continue a family tradition of beach holidays this summer, but a council decision on fire safety enforcement means she and other unit owners may be forced to make other plans.

item.title: Family receives letter from WWI relative more than a century after it was sent
item.description: The grandchildren of a World War I soldier who sent a message in a bottle from a transport ship say it is like a "clue in a treasure map".

item.title: Hungarian British author David Szalay wins Booker Prize 2025 for his novel Flesh
item.description: Hungarian British author David Szalay bests past winner Kiran Desai and former shortlistee Andrew Miller to win the prestigious Booker Prize for his sixth book, the "extraordinary, singular" Flesh.

item.title: Whitlam Dismissal live from 1975: How it unfolded, 50 years on
item.description: Fifty years ago today, prime minister Gough Whitlam was dismissed by governor-general Sir John Kerr. To mark the anniversary, we're putting you right there as it happened, covering the key moments of that fateful day in 1975 in real time.

item.title: US Supreme Court rejects call to overturn same-sex marriage legalisation
item.description: A former Kentucky court clerk who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples after a high court's 2015 ruling had been looking to appeal.

item.title: Influencer fined $830 for lighting fire on World Heritage-listed island K'gari
item.description: The woman lit a prohibited fire on the protected sand island and used a drone in a restricted area.

item.title: Wallabies desperate to avoid 67-year low on draining end of season Tour of Europe
item.description: After falling to England and Italy, the Wallabies are halfway towards becoming the first Australian tourists since 1958 to lose four straight Tests in Europe.

item.title: Te Maire Martin ready to aid Eli Katoa's recovery, but warns path may not be comparable
item.description: Te Maire Martin knows what it takes to get back on the field after a brain bleed, but warns that Eli Katoa's path is not going to be exactly identical for one reason.

item.title: Prices rising fastest in inner cities and growth towns during expanded 5 per cent deposit scheme
item.description: Inner cities, wealthy suburbs and fast-growing regional centres top the list of house price growth in October, according to a new deep dive focused on homes covered by the 5 per cent deposit scheme.

item.title: A motorised hydrofoiler rides well clear of swimmers off Adelaide's metropolitan coastline
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: International student awarded $10,000 in compensation after being evicted from UniLodge accommodation
item.description: An international student has been awarded $10,000 in compensation after a tribunal found she was unfairly evicted from her university accommodation after she made complaints about noisy students.

item.title: AI could be the ultimate test of Australia's democracy
item.description: Developing safe AI is not just an opportunity for a democracy like ours; ever since our superpower ally checked out of its responsibilities on this front, it's an obligation.

item.title: I thought I hated basketball. Now it's given me an amazing life
item.description: After breaking her back at 19 Katherine's community made sure she knew how special she was. Wheelchair basketball brought her back to earth and made her life "truly amazing".

item.title: Grounds revealed for State of Western Australia's appeal against abuse survivor Dion Barber's $2.8 million payout
item.description: The State of Western Australia is appealing the entire basis of a judgement which awarded a Perth man nearly $3 million in compensation for abuse he suffered while he was in state care.

item.title: England cricket great Ian Botham concerned by lack of warm-up matches prior to first Ashes Test
item.description: England's only warm-up game prior to the first Ashes Test will be an internal match, a fact that is greatly concerning legendary all-rounder Ian Botham.

item.title: West Australian man Patrick Joseph Hunter stands trial over alleged rape of girl under 10
item.description: Patrick Joseph Hunter, 46, is facing a charge of sexual penetration of a child under 13 and four counts of indecent dealing with a child under 13.

item.title: Satellite imagery matched to Sudan's El-Fasher shows the brutality of a massacre
item.description: Satellite imagery has shown pools of blood in Sudan’s El-Fasher, after the RSF militia took control. For relatives — finding out who has survived has turned into a torturous task.

item.title: Algal bloom exposes 'limitations' in government monitoring programs, Senate inquiry finds
item.description: A Senate inquiry into South Australia's toxic algal bloom has been tabled highlighting "limitations" in how the government has handled the crisis.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Indian anti-terror agency leading probe into Red Fort car explosion in Delhi
item.description: Narendra Modi has described the attack that killed at least eight people as a "conspiracy", vowing to bring those responsible to justice.

item.title: Turkish military cargo plane crashes in Georgia with 20 soldiers killed
item.description: Türkiye's defence ministry confirms 20 Turkish soldiers on board were killed in the crash.

item.title: Chinese 'cryptoqueen' fraud jailed in UK over $9b Bitcoin laundering scheme
item.description: British authorities say Zhimin Qian was the mastermind behind a Ponzi scheme into which around 128,000 people invested billions of dollars.

item.title: Princess Anne welcomed with open arms during Australian tour
item.description: Whether Princess Anne's visit has been enough to repair the damage to the monarchy's brand wrought by Andrew Mountbatten Windsor remains to be seen.

item.title: Spike in dolphin deaths at Huon Aquaculture pens prompts questions from Tasmanian regulator
item.description: Tasmanian regulators question major salmon farm operator Huon Aquaculture about the effectiveness of its "predator" nets after a spate of dolphin deaths.

item.title: Doctors defend emergency department triage policy as 'closing the gap in action'
item.description: Doctors and medical associations have backed a Melbourne hospital's emergency department triage policy to improve care for First Nations patients, describing criticisms of the closing the gap measure as 'opportunistic, uninformed'.

item.title: Leo relies on exercise physiology to keep him moving but that could change under NDIS review
item.description: Leo depends on exercise physiology to keep him moving, but there are fears that his progress could be halted under an NDIS review.

item.title: Farmers angry as Woolworths imports US butter in green and gold packaging
item.description: Australia's dairy industry is concerned a US brand, packaged in green and gold with a white colouring and bland flavour, looks as if it's locally made.

item.title: Joe Root a new player under Bazball despite previous Ashes struggles in Australia, says batting coach
item.description: England insists Joe Root's lack of centuries in Australia is not an issue, pointing to the fact he has thrived around the world under Brendon McCullum.

item.title: Federal politics: Liberals have met to decide fate of net zero policy in closed-door meeting — as it happened
item.description: The Liberals have met at Parliament House in Canberra after a marathon meeting to decide on the future of the party's net zero policy.

item.title: Coral larvae released as part of research project
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Scientists work to improve health of Great Barrier Reef during annual coral spawning event
item.description: A thick cloud of coral spawn has blanketed parts of the Great Barrier Reef this week, signalling a key window for restoration work.

item.title: CASA warns of 'zero tolerance' for helicopter safety breaches in wake of Matt Wright trial evidence
item.description: Australia's aviation watchdog has issued a warning to the sector, after accounts of widespread chopper rule-breaking were aired during the trial of Northern Territory croc wrangler Matt Wright.

item.title: Beau Webster, Matt Renshaw shine in Sheffield Shield ahead of Ashes
item.description: Beau Webster and Matt Renshaw remind selectors of their talents with stand-out performances in the Sheffield Shield on the eve of the Ashes.

item.title: How WA's outgoing Chief Health Officer Andy Robertson once hunted anthrax in Iraq
item.description: For WA's retiring Chief Health Officer Andy Robertson, the 2020 spread of the "novel coronavirus" was not the first time he had been part of a story of global significance — and he also fears the next pandemic could be worse.

item.title: Aboriginal team wins national award for suicide prevention work in Alice Springs
item.description: The Alice Springs team has been rewarded for its culture of listening to reduce high suicide rates in the Northern Territory.

item.title: Bunbury family distraught over Main Roads WA plan to remove 120-year-old tree
item.description: A 120-year-old tree is set to be removed to make way for a new intersection in the Bunbury suburb of Glen Iris, but a great-grandmother says she will be devastated to see it go.

item.title: Abuse lawyer slams WA government's decision to appeal Dion Barber's compensation for historical sexual abuse
item.description: A lawyer accuses the WA government of hijacking Dion Barber's $2.85 million compensation case for historical sexual abuse in a bid to "clarify law", instead of legislating it through parliament.

item.title: Alex de Minaur beaten by Lorenzo Musetti but still alive at ATP Finals
item.description: Alex de Minaur's hopes of reaching the ATP Finals semis hang by a thread after a heartbreaking three-set loss to Lorenzo Musetti.

item.title: Sam Kerr scores twice in first club start in 692 days as Chelsea defeat St. Pölten 6-0 in the Women's Champions League
item.description: Sam Kerr celebrates her first Chelsea start in almost two years by scoring a double, then declaring herself 100 per cent fit and "ready to go" for more game time and goals.

item.title: Drones assist researchers in studying hard-to-reach wildlife
item.description: Researchers are turning to drones to help them discover the health and habits of large marine mammals and other wildlife.

item.title: Good chance of aurora tonight, as two-year peak solar activity nears its end
item.description: One of nature's most magnificent shows, the southern lights, could be on display for large parts of southern Australia tonight with a severe solar storm event impacting on Earth. But the boom in aurora activity will not last forever.

item.title: Coonawarra wine association apologises for 'disappointing' T-shirts
item.description: The Coonawarra Vignerons, in South Australia's South East, has deleted a post which attracted controversy for celebrating binge drinking.

item.title: Manjimup avocado growers celebrate abundance of 'unusual' avocados
item.description: Avocado growers in WA's South West say the oddly shaped fruit popping up on their trees may cause a few chuckles, but that does not affect the taste.

item.title: Anthropologist under fire in Andrew Forrest's Ashburton River hearing
item.description: A lawyer for billionaire Andrew Forrest questions an anthropologist's credibility over his opposition to plans to change a sacred Pilbara waterway.

item.title: Tasmania's Hellyer Gold Mine shut down over unpaid royalties
item.description: The state government has directed Hellyer Gold Mines to cease operations at its mine in north-west Tasmania. It says the company has significantly fallen behind on its debts.

item.title: Toyah Cordingley's father gives evidence in trial of Rajwinder Singh, who is charged with murder
item.description: Toyah Cordingley's father has told a jury he paused to rest under a tree during the search for his daughter when he noticed an "odd-shaped mound" at his feet.

item.title: BHP ordered to pay miners $84,000 following Christmas holiday pay dispute
item.description: The Mining and Energy Union wins an appeal, arguing the mine operated for the pure purpose of profit over the public holiday period.

item.title: Gold Coast to host AACTA awards, festival through to 2028
item.description: An Australian film and television awards ceremony that has attracted Hollywood heavyweights, including Margot Robbie, will be held in Queensland until 2028.

item.title: Wollongong council seeks $44,000 for removing whale drowned by shark net
item.description: Wollongong City Council wants the NSW government to cover the $44,000 cost of recovering a humpback whale that drowned in a Coledale shark net.

item.title: Claims secret gas decarbonisation report 'doctored' by WA government to support net zero narrative
item.description: Last year the WA government commissioned a report on whether LNG exports to Asia were helping decarbonisation efforts — but the final report is vastly different to the draft, and analysts and activists say it has been doctored.

item.title: Not introverted or extroverted? You could be an otrovert
item.description: Unlike extroverts or introverts, otroverts don't look outward or retreat inward to be energised.

item.title: Ben Stokes calls out 'has-beens' after criticism of England's Ashes preparations
item.description: Critics of England's truncated preparation for this summer's Ashes Test series are off the mark, according to touring captain Ben Stokes.

item.title: Louvre heist 'detective' Pedro reveals inspirations behind viral look
item.description: Louvre heist "fedora man" Pedro Elias Garzon Delvaux says the inspiration behind his vintage look includes Agatha Christie's famed detective Hercule Poirot and James Bond.

item.title: NSW Reconstruction Authority sells flood buyback homes for as little as $1
item.description: Eleven flood buyback homes sell without a reserve price in the NSW Northern Rivers, with more to hit the market before the end of the year.

item.title: Melbourne Cup-winning jockey Jamie Melham suspended for 30 race meetings for careless riding
item.description: History-making jockey Jamie Melham has hit the headlines for the wrong reasons, with the Melbourne Cup winner banned for 30 race meetings for careless riding that resulted in a race fall for Blake Shinn.

item.title: Recruitment data shows unemployment rate worse than official figures suggest
item.description: The October unemployment rate is crucial because it will either cement the RBA's decision to keep interest rates on hold, or cause more confusion about monetary policy. Early evidence points to a weakening jobs market.

item.title: Inquest into death of Stanley Obi, allegedly set alight by former partner in murder-suicide, concludes
item.description: Stanley Obi, 33, died after his former partner Sarah Mudge set him and his then-partner alight. A coronial inquest hears he should have been asked if he was the victim of abuse.

item.title: Man found not criminally responsible for murder of Ray McCormack in Wollongong
item.description: Train station rough sleeper Aaron Michael Lord has been found not criminally responsible for the murder of Ray McCormack in a Wollongong stairwell.

item.title: Kyle and Jackie O escape prosecution over controversial comments during Erin Patterson trial
item.description: Victoria's Office of Public Prosecutions says it will not lay contempt of court charges against the controversial radio hosts, who made comments about the Erin Patterson case in the middle of her trial.

item.title: Queensland Health issues alert after three measles cases attend Jelly Roll concert at Brisbane Entertainment Centre
item.description: Queensland Health says the three infected people were at last month's concert of American singer Jelly Roll at the Brisbane Entertainment Centre and is warning others who attended to be alert for symptoms.

item.title: Four key takeaways from the Eddie Murphy documentary Being Eddie
item.description: Eddie Murphy has taken on many characters throughout his career, sometimes even within the same film. But a new documentary explores the "real Eddie Murphy" — someone the actor and comedian says few people actually know.

item.title: Bagpipers play tribute to AC/DC in world record attempt in Melbourne
item.description: The biggest ever ensemble of bagpipers gathered in Melbourne's Fed Square to play tribute to AC/DC, smashing a world record.

item.title: Queensland Health warns hospitals to strengthen procedures around medical imaging results
item.description: Authorities fear some patients involved in a medical imaging bungle have suffered long-term or permanent harm due to delays in receiving scan results and follow-up care.

item.title: Liberals still deciding fate of net zero policy
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Sawfish found with rostrum cut off on Port Hedland beach sparks anger
item.description: A video showing a critically endangered sawfish lying dead on a beach with its saw removed is described as "cruel" and "trophy hunting".

item.title: WA Environmental Protection Authority gives expanded ferry network tick of approval
item.description: Western Australia's environmental regulator decides not to formally assess plans to expand Perth's ferry services on the Swan River, despite pressure from the public.

item.title: Abortion legislation voted down in South Australian Parliament
item.description: A new push to change South Australia's abortion laws to limit terminations after 23 weeks has been voted down in state parliament's Upper House.

item.title: Donald Trump writes to Israel's president requesting pardon of Benjamin Netanyahu from corruption charges
item.description: Donald Trump has taken the extraordinary step of writing to Israel's President Isaac Herzog calling on him to pardon Benjamin Netanyahu of long-standing corruption charges.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein emails suggest Donald Trump knew about his sexual abuse
item.description: Donald Trump has denied any involvement in or knowledge of the sex-trafficking activities of his former friend, and the White House has accused Democrats of peddling a "fake narrative".

item.title: Cambodia and Thailand accuse each other of border violence amid reports of civilian casualties
item.description: Phnom Penh has accused Thai troops of killing a civilian at the border, just days after a peace deal between the two countries was paused by Thailand.

item.title: Liberals want to ditch net zero but IEA report says it's cheaper and cleaner
item.description: The most authoritative snapshot of where the global energy transition is going has just been released at a most opportune moment for any politician weighing which direction Australia should pursue.

item.title: Macquarie Point stadium goal at risk on eve of crucial AFL team vote
item.description: While Tasmania's MPs will pass the proposed AFL stadium through the lower house on Thursday, it's become a much tougher task ahead to win over the parliament's key upper house decision-makers.

item.title: Northern NSW growers welcome bumper grain harvest as south plagued by drought
item.description: Growers at Walgett are grinning from ear to ear as they fill their silos with a bumper grain harvest.

item.title: Almost half a million households could be eligible for federal government's co-purchasing scheme
item.description: The Help to Buy scheme will open to applicants soon. However, new research finds almost half a million households could be eligible for just 10,000 places in the co-ownership scheme.

item.title: Regulator raises alarm over insecticide use on blueberries, suspends products
item.description: The federal pesticide authority has updated how the chemical dimethoate can be used on berries after new data confirmed skyrocketing consumption has been putting young children over the safety limit.

item.title: Prabowo Subianto's foreign policy hints at what Indonesia gains from treaty with Australia
item.description: Details of an upgraded security treaty between Indonesia and Australia are yet to be made public, and the practical impact it will have on relations between the two countries depends on who you ask.

item.title: Sanjeev Gupta accused of deliberately losing phones in $US30m unpaid bonuses court case
item.description: Sanjeev Gupta is gone from the Whyalla steelworks but his troubles are far from over, with a former high-level international executive who oversaw the South Australian operation now suing for US $30 million in unpaid wages and bonuses.

item.title: Australians suffering 'irreversible complications' waiting years to see medical specialists
item.description: Some Australians are waiting more than six years to see health specialists, prompting doctors to warn that people are risking death while languishing on public waiting lists.

item.title: Scientists concerned for wellbeing of rare albino humpback whale that should be migrating south
item.description: A white humpback calf known as Siale is seen heading north along the NSW coast when most whales are searching for food in the Antarctic Ocean.

item.title: Menulog is closing down in Australia later this month. Here's what we know
item.description: The food delivery company is set to shut down on November 26. Here's what we know about the closure.

item.title: Sri Lankan cricketers forced to stay in Pakistan despite Islamabad bombing
item.description: Sri Lanka's cricket board has told concerned players they must stay in Pakistan to complete a white-ball tour despite 12 people dying in a bombing in Islamabad earlier this week.

item.title: Photos: Aurora Australis puts on dazzling display
item.description: One of nature's most dazzling shows was on display last night. Take a look at some of the photos taken across southern Australia.

item.title: Federal politics: Liberals to dump net zero by 2050, shadow ministers decide — as it happened
item.description: A meeting of Liberal shadow ministers ends with a decision to dump the net zero by 2050 target, following a party room meeting yesterday.

item.title: Hawthorn faces another AFLW finals exit in straight-sets as they struggle to recapture 2024 magic
item.description: Despite finishing the home-and-away season in fourth spot on the ladder — earning the double chance — Hawthorn has struggled to recapture the magic of its rapid 2024 rise and faces another straight-sets exit out of finals.

item.title: Financial pinch leaves Winter Olympic hopefuls struggling to afford skis
item.description: A ski mountaineering athlete and trail runner by day and a DJ by night, Lara Hamilton scrapes for every dollar to finance her dream of becoming a Winter Olympian.

item.title: ASX tumbles, Aussie dollar jumps as stronger jobs figures quash rate cut prospects — as it happened
item.description: The local share market takes another leg lower as labour force figures pour cold water on rate cut expectations. Look back on the day's financial news and insights from our specialist business reporters.

item.title: Two eight-year-old girls with nowhere to go highlight Kununurra's social issues
item.description: With young people in Kununurra making news for the wrong reasons over the last month, a police patrol shows the stark reality for children on the streets.

item.title: Missed last night's aurora australis? Here's when and where it's likely to put on a show tonight
item.description: The skies lit up overnight with a spectacular light show by the aurora australis. But as the two-year solar peak period ends, tonight may be your last chance to see the southern lights for a while.

item.title: PR campaign to relocate Melbourne sculpture to Mildura 'profoundly silly' says artist
item.description: The artist whose sculpture headlines a regional Victorian tourism campaign says it's a "beat up to get publicity".

item.title: 'Nothing was being done': Inpex workers raise fears over toxic chemical emissions and oil spills
item.description: In the wake of a federal government investigation, a worker at major oil and gas company Inpex has spoken out, raising fears of exposure to dangerous air pollutants and claims of a toxic workplace where staff concerns are brushed aside.

item.title: Gold Coast police officer's pull-up world record marred by online abuse
item.description: Jade Henderson says she has been the victim of online abuse since breaking the Guinness World Record for the most pull-ups in an hour.

item.title: Drone footage shows parts of Taiwan's Yilan already flooded ahead of Fung-wong.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Oscar Piastri set for test of 'character' as Formula 1 championship chase unravels
item.description: Oscar Piastri will have to show "character" after his recent F1 disappointments says his manager, former Australian ace Mark Webber.

item.title: More players involved in Shield, First Guardian collapses face ASIC legal action
item.description: Corporate watchdog ASIC is suing several players involved in the collapses of Shield and/or First Guardian, which led to Australians losing more than $1 billion of their retirement savings.

item.title: Emails reveal former prince Andrew talked to Jeffrey Epstein long after claiming he cut contact
item.description: Newly released emails reveal former prince Andrew begged Jeffrey Epstein to ensure a strong denial of his involvement with alleged crimes was sent to a tabloid.

item.title: Century-old Hereward shipwreck re-emerges at Sydney's Maroubra Beach
item.description: Shifting sands have re-exposed the Hereward shipwreck just metres from a swimming beach in Sydney's east.

item.title: Australia's unemployment rate slips to 4.3 per cent
item.description: The unemployment rate fell to 4.3 per cent in October, down from 4.5 per cent in September, as the number of people in employment increased by 42,200.

item.title: Teenager sentenced to 16 years behind bars for murder of grandmother Vyleen White at Ipswich shopping centre
item.description: The then-16-year-old stabbed the Queensland grandmother at a shopping centre in February last year as her granddaughter watched on.

item.title: Renowned lawyer returns to Wittenoom asbestos case that changed his life
item.description: Forty years ago, the Wittenoom asbestos disaster changed Peter Gordon's life. Now he has come back to finish what he started.

item.title: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell granted bail on charges relating to attack on Camp Sovereignty in Melbourne
item.description: Neo Nazi Thomas Sewell had been granted bail after a Supreme Court judge found he would not pose an unacceptable risk to the community.

item.title: Stephen Fleming sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter of Melbourne teacher Annette Brennan
item.description: Stephen Fleming has been sentenced to 10 years in jail for killing teacher Annette Brennan and placing her body in a wheelie bin in Melbourne's north.

item.title: Contact tracing underway in Queensland as health authorities brace for further measles cases
item.description: Health authorities expect to see more confirmed cases of measles in the next 48 hours as contact tracing into a Brisbane outbreak begins.

item.title: Hundreds of Qantas jobs to come to new innovation centre in Adelaide
item.description: The South Australian government has entered into an agreement with Qantas for a Product Innovation Centre that is expected to create more than 420 technology jobs by the end of 2028.

item.title: King of the Mountains trailer
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Documentary follows William Corlett's week-long 500km Blue Mountains run
item.description: A documentary following a young man's epic 500-kilometre run over seven days is nominated for awards at six international film festivals.

item.title: Australia's spring weather swings from hot to cold and back again in battle of the seasons
item.description: From heat, back to snow, fire danger and storm warnings — spring weather has given the country some serious whiplash. What's behind it?

item.title: Victoria will introduce adult jail sentences for children, but experts warn it won't fix youth crime
item.description: The Allan government will mirror Queensland with harsher jail sentences for children, but experts say the new legislation will not reduce youth crime.

item.title: Eliza West fell out of favour with Melbourne. Now she's leading Hawthorn in finals
item.description: Eliza West is leading the Hawks on a finals charge in the AFLW, but it comes after a 'disheartening' call at the Demons.

item.title: Traditional owner slams Andrew Forrest legal rehash over sacred Ashburton River serpent
item.description: An Aboriginal elder has slammed Andrew Forrest as a state tribunal into plans to alter a WA river hears critical evidence.

item.title: AC/DC concert shakes Melbourne all night long with low-level seismology recordings
item.description: Rock royalty AC/DC power up the earthshaking riffs at the MCG, rattling Melbourne with low-level seismic recordings.

item.title: Vote on releasing Jeffrey Epstein files set to go ahead as US government shutdown ends
item.description: As the longest government shutdown in US history winds up, a fresh bout of political infighting is brewing over the Jeffrey Epstein files.

item.title: Shelby Cobra among a dozen allegedly stolen vehicles found in central Victoria police raid
item.description: A $120,000 Shelby Cobra Roadster is found among a dozen allegedly stolen vehicles during a police raid in central Victoria.

item.title: Justis Huni leads tributes for trainer Keri Fui after fatal collapse in gym ahead of boxing return
item.description: Justis Huni leads tributes for long-time ally Keri Fui, who died from a heart attack while training the heavyweight boxer.

item.title: Police used unreasonable force in fatal shooting of Bradley Balzan, coroner finds
item.description: A coroner finds police used an unreasonable level of force during the fatal shooting of Sydney man Bradley Balzan, prompting sweeping recommendations to overhaul proactive policing practices in NSW.

item.title: Jury in trial of Rajwinder Singh, charged with Toyah Cordingley's murder, shown photographs of boyfriend's hike on day of her death
item.description: Former Innisfail nurse Rajwinder Singh is charged with the 24-year-old's 2018 death in Far North Queensland. The jury has today been shown photos of her partner Marco Heidenreich's activities on the afternoon she died.

item.title: Townsville mayoral candidate recruits lost tourist in exchange for lift to cruise ship
item.description: Joanne Keune maintains the tourist says it was the best thing that happened to him in Townsville.

item.title: Shay Mitchell's new skincare brand for children sparks controversy
item.description: A new skincare line for children by actress-turned-entrepreneur Shay Mitchell creates an online uproar, with many questioning the need for the products.

item.title: South Australian woman wins four-year court battle over $104 parking fine
item.description: A South Australian woman has won a four-year legal battle against an Adelaide council over a $104 parking fine.

item.title: Ley's net zero decision may bring her extra time as leader, but at what cost?
item.description: Ley's decision may have brought her extra time as leader. The question will be at what cost.

item.title: Cameron Green misses out on Sheffield Shield century on Ashes eve
item.description: Test all-rounder Cameron Green is dismissed six runs shy of a drought-breaking Sheffield Shield century, while Victoria coach Chris Rogers thinks he may have found Usman Khawaja's successor.

item.title: Unmasking the men who attended a Neo-Nazi protest outside NSW parliament
item.description: Around 60 men attended a protest at NSW parliament organised by the Neo-Nazi group National Socialist Network on Saturday. Without masks, it gave the ABC the opportunity to identify some of them.

item.title: Push to return 130GL of water to Murray-Darling Basin sparks backlash
item.description: More water rights in the Murray-Darling Basin will be purchased from farmers and irrigators in a renewed push by the federal government to return 450 gigalitres of water to the environment.

item.title: Jane Goodall farewelled in Washington, DC, Leonardo DiCaprio among mourners
item.description: The groundbreaking primatologist, who died in October, has been farewelled at a service in Washington, DC.

item.title: Growing evidence of secret taxpayer-funded boats for illegal foreign fishers
item.description: An Australian Border Force vessel has docked in Broome carrying four fishing boats, prompting anger from the fishing industry over a government scheme that gives illegal fishers boats to return home in.

item.title: Mark Wood suffers hamstring injury in England's pre-Ashes tour match
item.description: One of England's great bowling hopes for the summer cops a blow, as Mark Wood fails to finish the first day of a tour match.

item.title: Tasmanian salmon selectively bred to withstand warmer waters and bacterial disease
item.description: A salmon mass mortality event caused by a bacterial outbreak has given scientists "a lot of genetic knowledge" to put to use in a selective breeding program.

item.title: SA prison exec 'motivated by financial greed' in $300,000 prison upgrade rort, court hears
item.description: A South Australian court has heard that a correctional services executive was "motivated by financial greed" when he planned a $300,000 prison upgrade rort to fund his retirement.

item.title: Yipirinya School's future in doubt as enrolments plummet and debts mount
item.description: The future of an independent Indigenous school in Alice Springs is under a cloud after just 50 students turned up to class on Thursday, down from a peak enrolment of 360 in December last year.

item.title: National criminal history tracker to be established for working with children checks
item.description: Almost a decade after one was recommended by the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse.

item.title: Gaming addiction treatment pioneer, botanist honoured at WA Australian of the Year awards
item.description: The psychiatrist who pioneered the country's first gaming disorder clinic at a public hospital has been named the 2026 Australian of the Year for WA.

item.title: Chinese police offer cash bounty for information that helps arrest Taiwanese influencers Wen Tzu-yu and Chen Po-yuan
item.description: The pair are accused of spreading "anti-China" content after releasing a documentary last year, which detailed Beijing's attempts at using influencers to court public support for unification.
